Total cost = cost per metre x total perimeter
Perimeter of rectangle = 2 x (l+b)
Therefore, _{{4*l*(j+k)}}_ = 2 x (_{j}_y + _{k}_y) x _{l}_ .
_{{4*l*(j+k)}}_ = 2y x _{{ l*(j+k) }}_
2y = _{{4*l*(j+k)}}_/_{{ l*(j+k) }}_
y=2
\( \Rightarrow \) Now,the length = _{j}_y = _{j}_ x 2 = _{{2*j}}_ m

content.text: There is a narrow rectangular plot,reserved for a school, in Mahuli village. The length and breadth of the plot are in the ratio _{j}_:_{k}_. At the rate Rs._{l}_ per metre it will cost the village panchayat Rs_{{4*l*(j+k)}}_  to fence the plot. What is the length of the plot ?
